titles.title: Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2015

A bill to amend the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to clarify the Food and Drug Administration's jurisdiction over certain tobacco products, and to protect jobs and small businesses involved in the sale, manufacturing and distribution of traditional and premium cigars.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

term.name: Department of Health and Human Services
Drug safety, medical device, and laboratory regulation

bill.summary:
2/10/2015--Introduced. Traditional Cigar Manufacturing and Small Business Jobs Preservation Act of 2015
Amends the Federal Food, Drug, and Cosmetic Act to exempt traditional large and premium cigars from regulation by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) and from user fees assessed on tobacco products by the FDA.
